    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Address geocodeAddressBestMatch(Address address)
      Synchronously geocode an Address. There is no useful default way to handle this, and it is the ONE mandatory piece of a customer-provided Geocoding plugin.
      java.util.List<Address> geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address, int maxResults)
      By default, we simply "wrap" geocodeAddressBestMatch(). By default we ignore maxResults.
      java.util.List<Address> geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address)
      By default, we simply call geocodeAddressWithCorrections(address,-1) to ignore maxResults.
      java.util.List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude, java.math.BigDecimal longitude, int maxResults)
      By default, we simply "wrap" getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(). By default we ignore maxResults.
      java.util.List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude, java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
      By default, we simply call getAddressByGeocode(latitude,longitude, -1).
      Address getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(java.math.BigDecimal latitude, java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
      There is no practical "generic" way to find an address by Geocode and this is an optional operation. Plugins must override this method if they support Mapping.
      Country getCountryTypeCodeByName(java.lang.String countryName)
      Provides a single method to try find a Country by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation.) Has some limited "intelligence" for matching common short forms of country names.
      DrivingDirections getDrivingDirections(Address startAddress, Address finishAddress, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      There is no practical "generic" way to provide driving directions. Plugins must override this method if they support directions.
      MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address, UnitOfDistance unit)
      There is no practical "generic" way to generate maps. Plugins must override this method if they support Mapping.
      MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address, UnitOfDistance unit, java.lang.String options)
      By default, this simply drops the options string and calls the base getMapForAddress() method. Note that there is no practical "generic" way to generate maps. Plugins must override the base getMapForAddress() method if they support Mapping.

      Note that "options" is an opaque string; this is only useful if passed to a KNOWN plugin implementation. Plugins should ignore unknown options.
      State getStateByNameOrCode(java.lang.String stateName)
      Provides a single method to try find a State by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation.)
      static java.lang.String getUsefulCountryName(java.lang.String country)
      Performs some additional mappings of non-standardized Country names to standardized forms.
      boolean isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode(Address address)
      By default, this method checks if the address is sufficient to geocode without calling the service
      boolean pluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping with driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      boolean pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping with driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      boolean pluginSupportsCorrections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support corrections, so this defaults to returning false. Make sure to override this to return true if your plugin returns corrections and you want the application to log them.
      boolean pluginSupportsDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support findByGeocodeBestMatch(), so this defaults to returning false.
      boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple()
      By default, we wrap singleton returns, so we simple return the results of pluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
      boolean pluginSupportsMappingByAddress()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping, so this defaults to returning false.
      boolean pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support findByGeocodeBestMatch(), so this defaults to returning false.
      java.lang.String replaceNull(java.lang.String s)
      Replaces a null string with an empty string.

      Called during server startup and from the UI. All callback operations should be wrapped by the execute() method of the given StartablePluginCallbackHandler.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler,
         boolean serverStarting)
        Called during server startup and from the UI. All callback operations should be wrapped by the execute() method of the given StartablePluginCallbackHandler.
        Parameters:
        pluginCallbackHandler - Implementation of StartablePluginCallbackHandler that executes as the system user.
        serverStarting - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is starting; false if it comes from the UI

      • stop

        void stop(boolean serverShuttingDown)
        Called during server shutdown and from the UI
        Parameters:
        serverShuttingDown - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is shutting down; false if it comes from the UI

      • geocodeAddressBestMatch

        Address geocodeAddressBestMatch(Address address)
        Synchronously geocode an Address. There is no useful default way to handle this, and it is the ONE mandatory piece of a customer-provided Geocoding plugin.
        Parameters:
        address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. If successfully geocodeable, this address will be modified in-place to include the best match for Latitude and Longitude and set to a successful geocode status. If not, it should be set to the failure GeocodeStatus. If a network or transient error occurs, the address should not be modified and an exception should be thrown.
        Returns:
        An address. This should either be the original Address object, or a new Address object containing the best corrected match found by the Geocoding service.

      • geocodeAddressWithCorrections

      • getMapForAddress

        MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address,
                           UnitOfDistance unit,
                           java.lang.String options)
        By default, this simply drops the options string and calls the base getMapForAddress() method. Note that there is no practical "generic" way to generate maps. Plugins must override the base getMapForAddress() method if they support Mapping.

        Note that "options" is an opaque string; this is only useful if passed to a KNOWN plugin implementation. Plugins should ignore unknown options.

        Parameters:
        address -
        unit -
        options -
        Returns:

      • isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode

        boolean isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode(Address address)
        By default, this method checks if the address is sufficient to geocode without calling the service
        Parameters:
        address - to verify is sufficient to geocode
        Returns:
        true if the address contains a non-empty postal code, city, state, and country

      • getCountryTypeCodeByName

        Country getCountryTypeCodeByName(java.lang.String countryName)
        Provides a single method to try find a Country by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation.) Has some limited "intelligence" for matching common short forms of country names.

        Returns:
        the country's typekey
